intro: Rheedia benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthamic rheedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Rheedia benthamiana is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
